p: Materials with compositions x = 0.30–0.70 have a short-range polar order typical of relaxors and their photoluminescence shows a distinct crossover but a more complex behavior. The complexity partly arises from the heterogeneous nature of the relaxors at the nanoscale, corresponding to BaTiO 3 polar nanoregions embedded in a paraelectric matrix. Moreover, for these intermediate compositions several Eu 3+ sites corresponding to a different number of ZrO 6 (TiO 6) octahedra surrounding the lanthanide will give a significant contribution to the luminescence.
